title: How to Make Fennel and Nashi Pear Salad

steps.headline: Trim the leafy ends from the fennel.
Slice the fennel bulbs thinly.
steps.description: Keep the bulb slices separate from the fennel greens.

steps.headline: Make the dressing.
steps.description: Combine the chopped fennel greens in a large salad bowl with the olive oil, vinegar, lemon juice and sugar. Toss well.

steps.headline: Add the fennel bulb slices to a large glass or ceramic bowl.
steps.description: Pour the dressing over the top. Marinate the fennel bulb slices for one hour.

steps.headline: Cook the pasta spirals until al dente.
Drain when cooked and rinse quickly under running cool water.
Combine the cooked pasta spirals with the marinated fennel.
Peel and slice the nashi pears just prior to serving the salad.
steps.description: Add the slices of nashi pear to the fennel and pasta. Toss well.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: The salad can be served warm or cold.

text: Preparing the greens Trim the leafy ends from the fennel. Chop the leafy greens finely. Slice the fennel bulbs thinly. Keep the bulb slices separate from the fennel greens. Making the dressing Make the dressing. Combine the chopped fennel greens in a large salad bowl with the olive oil, vinegar, lemon juice and sugar. Toss well. Add the fennel bulb slices to a large glass or ceramic bowl. Pour the dressing over the top. Marinate the fennel bulb slices for one hour. Preparing the pasta Cook the pasta spirals until al dente.  Drain when cooked and rinse quickly under running cool water. Drain again. Assembling the salad Combine the cooked pasta spirals with the marinated fennel.  Peel and slice the nashi pears just prior to serving the salad. Add the slices of nashi pear to the fennel and pasta. Toss well. Serve immediately. The salad can be served warm or cold.
